section.para: This module is not built by default, it should be enabled with the --with-mail configuration parameter.

directive.name: listen
directive.para: The optional bind parameter instructs to make a separate bind call for a given address:port pair. The fact is that nginx will bind only to *:port if there are several listen directives with the same port but different addresses, and one of the listen directives listens on all addresses for the given port (*:port). It should be noted that the getsockname system call will be made in this case to determine an address that accepted a connection.
Different servers must listen on different address:port pairs.

directive.name: mail
directive.para: Provides a configuration file context in which the mail server directives are specified.

directive.name: protocol
directive.para: Sets the protocol of a proxied server. Supported protocols are IMAP, POP3 and SMTP.

If the directive is not set, the protocol can be detected automatically basing on the well-known port specified in the directive:
imap: 143, 993
pop3: 110, 995
smtp: 25, 587, 465
Unnecessary protocols can be disabled using the configuration parameters --without-mail_imap_module, --without-mail_pop3_module and --without-mail_smtp_module.

directive.name: server
directive.para: Sets a configuration for the server.

directive.name: server_name
so_keepalive
directive.para: Controls if the “TCP keepalive” mode should be enabled on the client’s connection (SO_KEEPALIVE socket parameter) on the proxied server connection.

directive.name: timeout
directive.para: Sets the timeout which is used before proxying to the backend started.
